alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 1:23AM PST until March 11 at 7:46AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...western and central San Luis Obispo County. * WHEN...Until 700 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Widespread ponding of water on area roadways and local flooding of low lying areas and intersections was occurring across the advisory area. Mudslides and rockslides are possible on canyon roads. There will likely be sharp rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain across much of the advisory area. Many locations were reporting rainfall rates of 0.20 to 0.40 inches per hour, with local rates up to one half inch per hour. Rainfall totals so far have averaged 0.75 inches to 1.5 inches, with local totals to almost 3 inches across the higher terrain. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected during the next several hours, with more than 4 inches possible across the higher terrain in the northwestern portion of the county. This additional rain will continue to result in widespread ponding of water, flooding of low lying areas and intersections, and rises in creeks and streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Grover Beach, Santa Margarita, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Templeton, Lake Lopez, Shell Beach, Avila Beach, Baywood-Los Osos and Oceano. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
